noun.description: The protection granted by a nation to someone who has left their native country as a political refugee.
examples: she applied for asylum and was granted refugee status

noun.description: An institution offering shelter and support to people who are mentally ill.
examples: he'd been committed to an asylum

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense place of refuge, especially for criminals): via Latin from Greek asulon refuge, from asulos inviolable, from a- without + sulon right of seizure. Current senses date from the 18th century.
